rules: Rule1: Provided that person1 is hospitalized at facility1, then person1 does not have close contact with person2.
Rule2: Under the condition that person1 tests positive for disease1, if the pandemic is not active for disease1, then person1 has recovered from disease1.
Rule3: Whenever person1 is contact traced, it follows that person1 is symptomatic for disease1 or tests positive for disease1.
Rule4: If person1 is location tracked, then person1 is symptomatic for disease1 or tests positive for disease1.
Rule5: Person1 has installed the app or uses a wearable.
Rule6: Provided that person1 uses a wearable, then person1 is location tracked.
Rule7: Whenever treatment is administered to person1 for disease1, the pandemic is active for disease1.
Rule8: Treatment is administered to person1 for disease1 or medication is prescribed to person1 for disease1.

Rule9: If a quarantine order is issued for person1, then whenever it is not the case that medication being prescribed to person1 for disease1 implies the pandemic is active for disease1, person1 experiences side effects.
Rule10: Whenever a legal mandate is imposed on person1, a quarantine order is issued for person1.
Rule11: In the event that trial is completed for game1 regarding disease1, vaccine is available for disease1.
Rule12: Provided that emergency approval is granted for disease1, the pandemic is active for disease1.
Rule13: If phase 3 is successful for game1 regarding disease1, then trial is completed for game1 regarding disease1.
Rule14: Phase 3 is successful for game1 regarding disease1 or disease1 is fast-tracked.
Rule15: If approval is granted for game1 regarding disease1, then whenever disease1 is fast-tracked, emergency approval is granted for disease1.
Rule16: Provided that person1 is vaccinated with game1, person1 is not quarantined at facility1.
Rule17: In the event that detection is early at facility1, infection rate is low at facility1.
Rule18: Provided that tracing is efficient at facility1, detection is early at facility1.
Rule19: If economic recovery occurs at facility1, lockdown is lifted at facility1.
Rule20: Economic recovery occurs at facility1 or restrictions are eased at facility1.
Rule21: If restrictions are eased at facility1, services are resumed at facility1.

Rule22: Outbreak is contained at facility1 or under the condition that it is not the case that the pandemic not being active for disease1 implies person1 is infected at facility1, person1 is vaccinated with game1.

Rule23: In the event that capacity is increased at facility1, then whenever it is not the case that the pandemic not being active for disease1 implies person1 is infected at facility1, person1 is vaccinated with game1.
Rule24: Under the condition that services are resumed at facility1, operations are normal at facility1.
Rule25: Whenever staff have returned to facility1, capacity is increased at facility1.
Rule26: If protocol is verified for person1 at facility1, then whenever operations are normal at facility1, staff have returned to facility1.
Rule27: If violation is detected for person1 at facility1, warning is issued to person1 at facility1.

Rule28: Violation is detected for person1 at facility1 or under the condition that compliance is checked for person1 at facility1, then provided that person1 is remotely monitored at facility1, person1 is not quarantined at facility1.
Rule29: Provided that warning is issued to person1 at facility1, penalty is imposed on person1 at facility1.
Rule30: Transmission is controlled at facility1 or outbreak is not contained at facility1.
Rule31: If review is initiated for person1 at facility1, then appeal is filed by person1 at facility1 or penalty is not imposed on person1 at facility1.
Rule32: Under the condition that research is funded for disease1, study is published for game1 regarding disease1.
Rule33: Provided that study is published for game1 regarding disease1, results are peer-reviewed for game1 regarding disease1.
Rule34: If trial is conducted for game1 regarding disease1, data is analyzed for game1 regarding disease1.
Rule35: Whenever observational study is performed for game1 regarding disease1, results are not peer-reviewed for game1 regarding disease1.
Rule36: Provided that randomized trial is conducted for game1 regarding disease1, trial is conducted for game1 regarding disease1.
Rule37: Under the condition that cohort study is performed for game1 regarding disease1, observational study is performed for game1 regarding disease1.
Rule38: If methodology is validated for game1 regarding disease1, then randomized trial is conducted for game1 regarding disease1 or cohort study is performed for game1 regarding disease1.
Rule39: In the event that adverse event occurs for person1 with disease1, complication is reported for person1 with disease1.
Rule40: Whenever complication is reported for person1 with disease1, medical review is conducted for person1 with disease1.

Rule41: If severity is assessed for person1 with disease1, then provided that it is not the case that medication being prescribed to person1 for disease1 implies the pandemic is active for disease1, person1 experiences side effects.
Rule42: Under the condition that medical review is conducted for person1 with disease1, severity is assessed for person1 with disease1.
Rule43: Whenever person1 is isolated at facility1, person1 does not have close contact with person2.
Rule44: Person1 is isolated at facility1 or hospitalized at facility1.
Rule45: If it is not the case that person1 having installed the app implies person1 is contact traced, then person1's privacy is violated.
Rule46: Under the condition that it is not the case that person1 having installed the app implies person1 is contact traced, person1's privacy is not violated.
Rule47: If it is not the case that medication being prescribed to person1 for disease1 implies the pandemic is active for disease1, person1 does not experience side effects.
Rule48: Under the condition that it is not the case that herd immunity is achieved at facility1 or outbreak is not contained at facility1, testing is comprehensive at facility1.
Rule49: Provided that it is not the case that herd immunity is achieved at facility1 or outbreak is not contained at facility1, infection rate is not low at facility1.
Rule50: Under the condition that it is not the case that person1 practicing social distancing at facility1 implies person1 is not immune to disease1, person1 has close contact with person2.

Rule51: Provided that it is not the case that it not being the case that testing being comprehensive at facility1 implies tracing is efficient at facility1 implies system is overloaded at facility1, resources are adequate at facility1.
Rule52: Whenever it is not the case that the pandemic not being active for disease1 implies person1 is infected at facility1, person1 is quarantined at facility1.
Rule53: Provided that it is not the case that the pandemic not being active for disease1 implies person1 is infected at facility1, person1 is remotely monitored at facility1.
Rule54: If it is not the case that the pandemic not being active for disease1 implies person1 has recovered from disease1, research is funded for disease1.
Rule55: Whenever the pandemic is not active for disease1, person1 is immune to disease1.
Rule56: If the pandemic is not active for disease1, person1 is not infected at facility1.
facts: Fact1: A legal mandate is imposed on person1.
Fact2: Approval is granted for game1 regarding disease1.
Fact3: Protocol is verified for person1 at facility1.
Fact4: Compliance is checked for person1 at facility1.
Fact5: Review is initiated for person1 at facility1.
Fact6: Methodology is validated for game1 regarding disease1.
Fact7: Adverse event occurs for person1 with disease1.
Fact8: Person1 practices social distancing at facility1.
Fact9: Person1 has not recovered from disease1.
Fact10: Person1 is not symptomatic for disease1.
Fact11: Vaccine is not available for disease1.
Fact12: Herd immunity is not achieved at facility1.
Fact13: System is not overloaded at facility1.
Fact14: Resources are not adequate at facility1.
Fact15: Lockdown is not lifted at facility1.
Fact16: Transmission is not controlled at facility1.
Fact17: Appeal is not filed by person1 at facility1.
Fact18: Data is not analyzed for game1 regarding disease1.
